title: The Dark Lord Cometh

embed.description: The baleful revenant Mordekaiser is among the most terrifying and hateful spirits haunting the Shadow Isles. He has existed for countless centuries, shielded from true death by necromantic sorcery and the force of his own dark will.

replies.body:
So, apparently Ochnun the dark tongue of whispers and death is German. The more you know. 

I’m now picturing a bunch of ghosts haunting humans just to say gesundheit, and calling each other schweinehund.
Huh, so that's where the word 'Poltergeist' is from.
I'm wondering why they kept his color text as it was considering that now there is no connection between him and the Black Mist.
His new color story is supposed to be arriving fairly soon. _Shadows of Damnation_ is currently a placeholder.
Thank you.

One notable addition is morde allowing himself to be betrayed by leblanc so that he could make use of the souls he accumulated in his afterworld.

Well i like to think of it as the new bio just stops before his most recent resurrection. In the Ezreal story, Januk mentions the "Dread lord will rise again" so maybe when Morde comes back he'll be resurrected on the Shadow Isles. 

It also makes one of his new quotes make more sense, "Twice slain, thrice reborn."

I'm willing to guess he'll still be connected with the Shadow Isles, either in his story or in the future. He's using the power of souls to build his afterlife, and I'm guessing the Shadow Isles is looking like a lumber liquidation sale to Mordekaiser.
So is Mordekaiser Xanatos now?
Honestly I like Sahn-Uzal more than Mordekaiser. Sound's cooler imo. Also it sounds more like some lost language of the dead than Mordekaiser does.

I do not, he looks far weaker and less charismatic than the most recent old Mordekaiser whose reign and fall looked far more epic and tyrannical.

I really like though how he kept himself form fading away and I **really** like that even LB's betrayal was part of his plan, the new Mordekaiser looks far more subtle and planning than the older one who was more of a pure powerful warmonger. I really want to read more about him.
This comment has little to do with what I said. But I have to disagree with him seeming weaker and less charismatic. He bent the very world of the dead to his will... that's pretty dang powerful.
He didn't bend the whole world of the dead to his will. He only created his own Death Realm, other spirits are still out of his reach.

> [{quoted}](name=Dyromic,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=GAlb6RnM,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2019-05-30T10:23:46.770+0000)
>
> He didn't bend the whole world of the dead to his will. He only created his own Death Realm, other spirits are still out of his reach.

he did so by seizing control of any he killed (the dead in general after eons of studying necromancy and learning the magicks of death). It appears that his sorcerors did too good a job of mightifying him after he died.

Yes, he only enchains those spirits he himself kills or those who are killed near to him. Other souls can still access the afterlife, so Morde's Death Realm is something like a smaller area in the greater realm of the Afterlife.

The existence of the Shadow Isles and the fact those spirits are not controlled by Morde makes it clear that Morde is not Death's only master and someone after his death won't necessarily be doomed for eternal servitude (or at least not under Morde). Sion is another example of an undead who is not controlled by Mordekaiser.
Just imagine a Sahn-Uzal skin for Mordekaiser, would be epic.

The bio is great but 2 things I liked about the old one: Mordekaiser always being his name (Although technically it was anyways so....and I like that his old mortal self died and he was reborn). I also preferred him being empowered by the shadow isles and being part of the mist. Plus him not being part of it doesn't explain his spooky green glow. He is still awesome and his lore is great but being a Shadow Isles champ makes him even cooler rather than just Noxus.

Pretty sure Riot is making it so anything to do with death has that Shadow Isles blueish green glow. I.E. Necromancy, ghosts from the black mist, champions, etc. If you notice even Pyke's ult and weapon has the same coloring and he is Bligewater champion

Does this mean, he isn't the one commanding the Black Mist during a Harrowing?

If this is the case, the Ruined King still has a chance being relevant in the lore, which is kinda nice I guess.
